summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing a press conference held in front of Jeffrey Epstein's house on January 28, 2020, by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and Safe Horizon. The emails reveal FBI agents' frustration over the event, which upset victims who were not notified, and clarify the press conference was about human trafficking awareness, not specifically the Epstein case, though it included a remark about Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman

persons.name: Prince Andrew

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, made a public statement about Prince Andrew during a press conference related to human trafficking awareness held at Epstein's residence.

events.title: Press Conference at Epstein's House
events.description: A press conference co-sponsored by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and Safe Horizon was held in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone to raise awareness for human trafficking. It included a remark about Prince Andrew and upset Epstein case victims who were not notified.

keyFacts: A press conference on human trafficking awareness was held in front of Jeffrey Epstein's house on January 28, 2020, by SDNY and Safe Horizon.
The press conference included a remark about Prince Andrew, but was not focused on the Epstein case details.
FBI agents expressed frustration over the event, noting it upset victims who felt betrayed due to lack of prior notification.
Internal FBI communication indicates a breakdown in coordination between the USAO and the FBI regarding the press conference.
The U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and FBI claimed the press conference was not planned in advance regarding Epstein case discussions.
